captions.text: I do not shave my legs.
I don't know why I shave my legs.
I guess it's just cuz that's what people do?
If I think someone I like is going to see my legs, then I'll shave my legs.
And I think it does feel better.
Honestly, I feel like I shave more for other women than for men.
That just doesn't sound worth it.
My mother used to tell me that beauty is pain.
No that doesn't sound right... No.
If there's a chance my flesh is gonna get eaten, or have hairy legs... I'll just go with hairy legs.
I would be scared if I had this in my bathroom that I would be tired and put it on my hair.
I think it makes sense that women shave their legs because of marketing. Women do a lot of things because of marketing.
I think that's like the world that we live in.
And being aware of it, is important.
Not the way I do it. I'm an efficient shaver.  *laughter*
S*** who shaves their legs everyday?

title: Why Do Women Shave Their Legs?

comments.author: MissMishaMarina

comments.text:
It's weird (and illogical) for people to think that shaving leg hair is 
"hygienic". If hair is unhygienic, why do most of you still have eyebrows, 
eyelashes, and hair on your scalp? Also, why don't we hold men to the same 
standard of "hygiene"? 

The reason is because it's not an issue of hygiene. It's purely aesthetic. 
If you wash yourself often (every day for most people in the USA), there is 
nothing unhygienic about your body hair. You are just succumbing to another 
social norm like shaping your eyebrows and getting french tips. If you like 
that sort of thing, great, but please don't make others who don't do those 
things (because of culture or personal preference) feel dirty because they 
don't participate.﻿

comments.author: Chauntiana Thomas

comments.text:
Everyone here with an opinion other than 'the way your body naturally grows 
hair is a-ok' has been grossly misinformed and socialized in a really 
harmful way. 
the reason you think hair is unclean but only on women is because how else 
will society force you to shave your body hair and look a certain way? how 
else will they sell you razors? 
when I was going into middle school and wanted to shave my legs because 
everyone else was doing it, my mother wouldn't let me-she wanted me to be 
comfortable with myself and she was also probably holding onto my childhood 
innocence. As an adult, I don't shave, legs or underarms, and it distresses 
her to no end. She calls it filthy and ugly and cries if I go out in public 
without being hair free. 
Altering the way your body is naturally is not 'just the way things are' 
that makes no sense and with a little comprehension and critical thinking 
I'm sure even the worst of you can understand why women who don't shave 
(aka women who just live their lives and are not actively concerned with 
body hair on a daily basis) are not even making a statement we're just NOT 
doing something. If you want to shave fine, but recognize why you make the 
choice to do something to change your appearance and are offended when 
others don't make the same choice that you do.﻿
comments.author: Heidi Shoshana

comments.text:

I'd hate to think about having to shave every day...sounds exhausting, I 
got better stuff to do﻿

comments.author: Michelle bloop

comments.text:
The amount of stigma and negativity in this post is unreal. 
Hair is a natural thing, its a choice to do whatever you like with it. Not 
shaving is not unhygienic, your body oils are good and soap would remove 
anything regardless of hair. Its sad how uncomfortable people are that 
other people might not shave their legs and then jump in to shame them. 
Everyone has personal preferences and I would much rather see people happy 
with their bodies then feeling like they would be attached for doing 
something they feel comfortable with. Do what makes you happy, don't change 
for anyone else . Most importantly think before you judge people for doing 
what makes them happy, especially if its because of your insecurities.  I 
also saw some posts about feminists saying no one should shave, feminism is 
about equality and choice thats all you could do either.

Personally I stopped shaving a year ago, if not more and only waxed and now 
I do whatever makes me happy which has lead to less and less hair removal. 
it just seems unnecessary to me my boyfriend has never minded and while he 
jokes occasionally I wouldn't change myself and feel insecure for him.

I feel like a lot of people making posts are young and insecure, just love 
yourself and be open to other people. Do what makes you happiest, not what 
makes others happy.﻿
comments.author: Jasmine Taulu

comments.text:
